content:
# elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram Weekly Report (Jan 4 - 10, 2026)

## üöÄ Highlights
This was a quiet week for the Telegram plugin, with no new code contributions or pull requests. The primary activity centered on issue tracking, with the identification of a new bug. A user reported a significant crash involving a `TypeError` when the plugin attempts to process images uploaded natively as photos, which will require investigation in the coming weeks.

## üõ†Ô∏è Key Developments
There were no technical developments, features, or bug fixes merged this week. The codebase remains unchanged from the previous period.

## üêõ Issues & Triage
The focus of the week was on identifying a new problem area rather than resolving existing ones.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed this week.
- **New & Active Issues:** A new bug was reported in issue [#23](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram/issues/23). The report details a `TypeError` that occurs in the `processImage` function, causing the plugin to crash when a user uploads an image "as a photo" instead of "as a file" through the Telegram client. There were no significant discussions on other active issues.

## üí¨ Community & Collaboration
Community and collaborative activity was minimal this week. No pull requests were opened for review, and there were no notable discussions on active issues, indicating a period of low development activity.
